messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Tony King interviewing some Caribbean musician??  who?
messages.msgSnippet: Sandra, My satellite guide says Eric Christian, music critic.  Could that be right?  Sorry I don t have any more information.  ( Satellite Guide - sounds like
messages.messageBody:
Sandra,
My satellite guide says Eric Christian, music critic. Could that be
right? Sorry I don't have any more information. ( Satellite Guide -
sounds like a cosmic spirit guide )

Regarding your other post - a little more on " why unschooling..."
Thanks.
Deb L

messages.subject: Tony King interviewing some Caribbean musician??  who?
messages.msgSnippet: This is the weirdest question I ve ever asked but if unschoolers don t know, who will?? I turned on the Tony King show on PBS this afternoon for just a bit,
messages.messageBody:
This is the weirdest question I've ever asked but if unschoolers don't know,
who will??

I turned on the Tony King show on PBS this afternoon for just a bit, and he
was interviewing a guy who was talking about Caribbean music, but it was
winding down. While it was all fascinating, I was left without much of the
gist of the conversation (was the guy a producer of recordings? a folklorist
or musicologist? I couldn't tell), and at the end Tony King thanked him but
didn't summarize or name him! Ack! I looked online some and didn't find it.

I'm hoping someone here saw that or knows, or has a PBS schedule that names
the guy.

Thanks

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
